page.title: 01The Headteachers summary.
page.content:
Somerby situated on a ironstone ridge 600ft above sealevel in the east of Leicestershire. Built in linear form with no actual centre it is rather an ugly village from the road but it has beautiful countryside all round. The school built for 120 pupils now has only 37.Housing is mostly converted farm workers cottages.There is a small council estate of 20 houses.Shopping in the village is very expensive and limited so most families make a weekly trip to Melton Mowbray or Oakham both journeys of six miles.The recreational facilities for children are reasonable but for young adults there is nothing which causes drift to the towns.
Myra Barratt Headteacher Somerby School.
